arm_group.description: After baseline screening, participants receive weekly or bi-weekly food deliveries and brief nutrition education.

brief_summary.textblock:
This application, funded by the American Association of Retired Persons(AARP) Foundation, is
      to implement the Healthy Eating for at Risk Older Adults (HERO) initiative. This initiative
      will address barriers of affordability, and reduced mobility by providing older adults with
      nutritious foods that are usually difficult to purchase due to high cost; delivering needed
      foods to individuals in their homes; tailoring food delivery frequency based on level of
      food insecurity; and offering basic nutrition education.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Improve Healthy Eating for At-Risk Older Adults

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  55 years old or older

          -  if member of Boston Medical Center's Elders Living at Home Program: Not currently
             homeless and expect to live at current residence or in the area for next 6 months

          -  if NOT member of Boston Medical Center's Elders Living at Home Program: Not currently
             homeless, live at public housing development, and plan to live there for at least
             next 6 months

          -  Able to understand, speak and read English

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Follows a special diet that cannot be accommodated, as ascertained by clinical
             judgment of the nurse.

intervention.description: Frequency of food deliveries is based on level of food insecurity at baseline (i.e., more food insecurity receives more frequent food deliveries). Deliveries are tailored to the diet of the client (e.g., consist of soft foods if participant has trouble chewing; has more fruits and vegetables if that was a food category the participant at less of at baseline). The brief nutrition education is a review of basic nutrition concepts and healthy eating ideas.

clinical_study.official_title: Healthy Eating for At-Risk Older Adults (HERO)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: food frequency questionnaire assessing levels of food intake in pre-specified categories (e.g., fruits and vegetables)
measurement of food insecurity as assessed by standard questionnaire

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
